org.dataconservancy.packaging.gui.view

Interface CreateNewPackageView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    View<CreateNewPackagePresenter>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CreateNewPackageViewImpl

    public interface CreateNewPackageView
extends View<CreateNewPackagePresenter>
    The view for creating a new package. This view gives the option of selecting a base directory to create a package from, or loading an existing package description.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.control.Button getChooseContentDirectoryButton()
      The button for choosing a base directory to generate a package description from.
      javafx.scene.control.Button getChoosePackageDescriptionButton()
      A button for selecting an existing package description to load.
      javafx.scene.control.Label getErrorMessage()
      Label for displaying an error message to the user, typically when a required field has not been selected.
      PackageToolPopup getProgressIndicatorPopUp() 
      Map<String,String> getPropertyValues()
      This returns a map of property names (keys) and their associated value, as input by the user.
      javafx.scene.control.TextField getSelectedBaseDirectoryTextField()
      A text field that is used for displaying the currently selected directory.
      javafx.scene.control.TextField getSelectedPackageDescriptionTextField()
      A text field that displays the currently selected package description.
      void promptForUndefinedProperties(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.support.RulePropertiesManager mgr)
      This brings up input fields for defining any properties (such as project ID) to use during package description creation.
      void showProgressIndicatorPopUp()

      • getSelectedBaseDirectoryTextField

        javafx.scene.control.TextField getSelectedBaseDirectoryTextField()
        A text field that is used for displaying the currently selected directory. Note a text field is used here to allow the user to scroll the text to see the entire path. The text field however is not editable.
        Returns:
        The TextField to use for entering the in base directory.

        Returns:

      • getSelectedPackageDescriptionTextField

        javafx.scene.control.TextField getSelectedPackageDescriptionTextField()
        A text field that displays the currently selected package description. Note a text field is used here to allow the user to scroll the text ot see the entire path. The text field however is not editable.
        Returns:
        The text field for displaying hte selected package description.

      • promptForUndefinedProperties

        void promptForUndefinedProperties(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.support.RulePropertiesManager mgr)
        This brings up input fields for defining any properties (such as project ID) to use during package description creation.
        Parameters:
        mgr - The rules manager that will be used to determine undefined properties
